bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. GUINTA:H.R. 1806.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1 Section 8 Clause 3 of the United StatesConstitution which allows the Congress to regulate Commercewith foreign Nations, and among the several States, and withthe Indian Tribes.[Page H3160]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text: Bluefin Tuna Fishermen Employment Preservation Act - Amends the Endangered Species Act of 1973 to prohibit treatment of the Bluefin tuna as an endangered or threatened species.

bill.title: Bluefin Tuna Fishermen Employment Preservation Act

item.title: Bluefin Tuna Fishermen Employment Preservation Act
Bluefin Tuna Fishermen Employment Preservation Act
To amend the Endangered Species Act of 1973 to provide that Bluefin tuna may not be treated as an endangered species or threatened species.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
